meanings.definition: A person or thing that extrapolates data or information.
meanings.sent1: The extrapolators in the lab analyzed the results to make predictions.
meanings.sent2: The company hired expert extrapolators to interpret the market trends.
meanings.sent3: The team of extrapolators had a competition to see who could predict the weather most accurately.
meanings.sent4: She was like an extrapolator, always able to foresee the outcome of any situation.
meanings.sent5: The extrapolators were like detectives, piecing together clues to solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: The act of estimating or concluding something based on known information.
meanings.sent1: After careful analysis, the extrapolators made a projection about the future sales.
meanings.sent2: Extrapolators use existing data to make educated guesses about upcoming trends.
meanings.sent3: The party planner was an expert extrapolator, foreseeing exactly how many guests would attend.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like an extrapolator, always jumping ahead to the next logical step.
meanings.sent5: The extrapolators' predictions were so accurate, it was as if they could see into the future.
